div.l: So farith it / bi a y y ryetous servaıı̄unt
It is wel lasse harm / to late hym passe
Than he shende / aƚƚlle servaıı̄untis in the place
Ther for his maistir / yaf hym acquytaunce
And bad hym go / with sorwe and myschaıı̄unce
And thus the Ioly prentys / hadde his leve
Now late hym ryote al nyht or bileve
And ther is isis isis no theef / with oute a lowke
What helpith hym to wasten / ⁊and to soupe
Of that he bribe can / or borwe may
A noon he sente his bedde / ⁊and his array
Vn to a compere / of his owne sort
That loved dys / revel and disport
And hadde a wyf that held for contynaıı̄unce
A shoppe / ⁊and swyvyng / for her sustinaıı̄unce

l.hi: Chaūcer maad no moor of the cookis tale
Heer bigynneth the ꝓprolog͗e of þᵉ ʆsergeaıı̄untꝭes tale of lawe

div.l: ovr hoost saw wel that the bryht sonne
The ark of his artificial day / hath ronne
The forth ꝑparte / and half an owre and more
And thouh he were nat deep / expert in lore
He wiste it was / the eyht and twenti day
Of Aueryll / that is messageer to may
And sawe wel / that the shadwe / of euery tree
Was asas in lengthe / the same quāantitee
As was the body erect / that caused it
And therfore bi the shadowe / he took his wyt
That Phebus which shoon / so fayr and bryht
Degrees was fyue and fourty clombe on hiht
And for that day / as in the latitude
It was ten at the Clok / he gan conclude
And sodeynly he plyhte / his hors aboute
Lordynges qduod he / I warne yow al this route
The foorthe ꝑparte / of this day is goon
